intro: Tomostima sonorae, commonly known as the Sonoran tomostima, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and thrives in full sun, showcasing adaptations to its harsh environment. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are dispersed by wind, contributing to its survival in sparse vegetation. Tomostima sonorae plays a minor but ecologically significant role in its native habitat.
